p: In conclusion, it was found that the artificial modification in the chemical composition of orange oils causes variation in their larvicidal action; noting that the biological activity could depend in direct relation to the concentration of limonene present in the samples, since when the concentration of limonene decreased, a decrease in lethality was observed; For this reason, the oil sample that was not subjected to treatment with electric pulses generally showed greater larvicidal action on Drosophila melanogaster when compared to the modified oils used in this study.
